Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Having reviewed the survey report, we understand from the Loss Adjuster that the repair cost quoted recommended by the contractor is overstated. 

 

The assigned loss adjuster requested the original installation cost to support, but this was never provided.


MS IDC Interiors General Contractors, an independent professional contractor, was then appointed and provided a competitive proposal (see attached). 

 

You are allowed to choose any contractor they want to use, however please keep in mind that our maximum obligation will be the amount quoted by IDC.

 

In view of the above, we are now pleased to offer the below:

Damaged stock:                                                 KWD 720.69

Repairs to Fixtures and Fittings:                     KWD 5,020.00

Gross Loss:                                                    KWD 5,740.69

Less Excess (10% of claim amount):                KWD 574.07 

Net Settlement:                                                KWD 5,166.62 / AED 61,772.02

 

Please proceed with the repairs and provide us with the repair receipt.

Dear Dina,

 

Based on loss adjuster’s site inspection, please note the following. 

 

Quote: 

 

We attended upon your client on the afternoon of Wednesday 14 February 2024 and oversaw physical disposal of the stock by Mr Abdullah Ersheid, which is now complete.  

 

Now we are awaiting your client’s formal claim submission and supporting documents to allow us to finalise quantification of their claim.  This is not so much in relation to the stock, with respect to which we have the count records and documentation, albeit they should still include this information with their formal claim submission, but is more with respect to such as:

 

i.             Removal and making safe ceiling chandelier to allow the ceiling to be redecorated.

ii.           Cabinet replacements/repair

iii.          floor plinths replacements/repair

iv.          Desk repairs Etc.  

 

Ideally, your client should provide comparison repair quotations for the above, but if your client has a preferred vendor (the original contractor we presume, if so), their quotation would be acceptable, but we would appreciate sight of original fit-out costs for comparison purpose so we can assess whether the quotations are adequately stated/presented.

	Good morning,

	Kindly find the attached snapshots for reference.

	 

	 

	Regards 

	Group security Control Room.

chunks.text:
Having reviewed the survey report, we understand from the Loss Adjuster that the repair cost quoted recommended by the contractor is overstated. 

 

The assigned loss adjuster requested the original installation cost to support, but this was never provided.


MS IDC Interiors General Contractors, an independent professional contractor, was then appointed and provided a competitive proposal (see attached). 

 

You are allowed to choose any contractor they want to use, however please keep in mind that our maximum obligation will be the amount quoted by IDC.

 

In view of the above, we are now pleased to offer the below:

Damaged stock:                                                 KWD 720.69

Repairs to Fixtures and Fittings:                     KWD 5,020.00

Gross Loss:                                                    KWD 5,740.69

Less Excess (10% of claim amount):                KWD 574.07 

Net Settlement:                                                KWD 5,166.62 / AED 61,772.02

 

Please proceed with the repairs and provide us with the repair receipt. 

 

Thanking you.

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil 

Assistant Claims Manager - General Insurance





Nasco Middle East
P.O. Box 62528, Dubai, UAE

Dear Dina,

 

Based on loss adjuster’s site inspection, please note the following. 

 

Quote: 

 

We attended upon your client on the afternoon of Wednesday 14 February 2024 and oversaw physical disposal of the stock by Mr Abdullah Ersheid, which is now complete.  

 

Now we are awaiting your client’s formal claim submission and supporting documents to allow us to finalise quantification of their claim.  This is not so much in relation to the stock, with respect to which we have the count records and documentation, albeit they should still include this information with their formal claim submission, but is more with respect to such as:

 

i.             Removal and making safe ceiling chandelier to allow the ceiling to be redecorated.

ii.           Cabinet replacements/repair

iii.          floor plinths replacements/repair

iv.          Desk repairs Etc.  

 

Ideally, your client should provide comparison repair quotations for the above, but if your client has a preferred vendor (the original contractor we presume, if so), their quotation would be acceptable, but we would appreciate sight of original fit-out costs for comparison purpose so we can assess whether the quotations are adequately stated/presented.

If the vendor has not yet finalised their quotation to your client and need to re-attend site, it would be helpful if your client could inform us in timely fashion, as it will save time for us to meet with the vendor on site so we can discuss with them any mutual concerns face-to-face.

med Eltahan <Ahmed.Eltahan@chalhoub.com <mailto:Ahmed.Eltahan@chalhoub.com> >, Hasna Raissi <Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com> >
	Subject: FACES AL-Khairan (Water leakage)

	﻿ 

	Dear Louay & Emmanuel,

	Good morning,

	 

	In response to the request from the Mr. Louay, we reviewed CCTV cameras for FACES AL-KHAIRAN Kuwait and found that there was water leakage in the store floor from the ceiling at 02:31hrs and ended at 02:54hrs, 

	 

	Kindly find the attached snapshots for reference.

	 

	 

	Regards 

	Group security Control Room.

Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Having reviewed the survey report, we understand from the Loss Adjuster that the repair cost quoted recommended by the contractor is overstated. 

 

The assigned loss adjuster requested the original installation cost to support, but this was never provided.


MS IDC Interiors General Contractors, an independent professional contractor, was then appointed and provided a competitive proposal (see attached). 

 

You are allowed to choose any contractor they want to use, however please keep in mind that our maximum obligation will be the amount quoted by IDC.

 

In view of the above, we are now pleased to offer the below:

Damaged stock:                                                 KWD 720.69

Repairs to Fixtures and Fittings:                     KWD 5,020.00

Gross Loss:                                                    KWD 5,740.69

Less Excess (10% of claim amount):                KWD 574.07 

Net Settlement:                                                KWD 5,166.62 / AED 61,772.02

 

Please proceed with the repairs and provide us with the repair receipt.

Dear Dina,

 

Based on loss adjuster’s site inspection, please note the following. 

 

Quote: 

 

We attended upon your client on the afternoon of Wednesday 14 February 2024 and oversaw physical disposal of the stock by Mr Abdullah Ersheid, which is now complete.  

 

Now we are awaiting your client’s formal claim submission and supporting documents to allow us to finalise quantification of their claim.  This is not so much in relation to the stock, with respect to which we have the count records and documentation, albeit they should still include this information with their formal claim submission, but is more with respect to such as:

 

i.             Removal and making safe ceiling chandelier to allow the ceiling to be redecorated.

ii.           Cabinet replacements/repair

iii.          floor plinths replacements/repair

iv.          Desk repairs Etc.  

 

Ideally, your client should provide comparison repair quotations for the above, but if your client has a preferred vendor (the original contractor we presume, if so), their quotation would be acceptable, but we would appreciate sight of original fit-out costs for comparison purpose so we can assess whether the quotations are adequately stated/presented.

If the vendor has not yet finalised their quotation to your client and need to re-attend site, it would be helpful if your client could inform us in timely fashion, as it will save time for us to meet with the vendor on site so we can discuss with them any mutual concerns face-to-face.

Attached is the video for your reference.

med Eltahan <Ahmed.Eltahan@chalhoub.com <mailto:Ahmed.Eltahan@chalhoub.com> >, Hasna Raissi <Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hasna.Raissi@chalhoub.com> >
	Subject: FACES AL-Khairan (Water leakage)

	﻿ 

	Dear Louay & Emmanuel,

	Good morning,

	 

	In response to the request from the Mr. Louay, we reviewed CCTV cameras for FACES AL-KHAIRAN Kuwait and found that there was water leakage in the store floor from the ceiling at 02:31hrs and ended at 02:54hrs, 

	 

	Kindly find the attached snapshots for reference.

	 

	 

	Regards 

	Group security Control Room.

Having reviewed the survey report, we understand from the Loss Adjuster that the repair cost quoted recommended by the contractor is overstated. 

 

The assigned loss adjuster requested the original installation cost to support, but this was never provided.


MS IDC Interiors General Contractors, an independent professional contractor, was then appointed and provided a competitive proposal (see attached). 

 

You are allowed to choose any contractor they want to use, however please keep in mind that our maximum obligation will be the amount quoted by IDC.

 

In view of the above, we are now pleased to offer the below:

Damaged stock:                                                 KWD 720.69

Repairs to Fixtures and Fittings:                     KWD 5,020.00

Gross Loss:                                                    KWD 5,740.69

Less Excess (10% of claim amount):                KWD 574.07 

Net Settlement:                                                KWD 5,166.62 / AED 61,772.02

 

Please proceed with the repairs and provide us with the repair receipt. 

 

Thanking you.

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil 

Assistant Claims Manager - General Insurance

Dear Dina,

 

Based on loss adjuster’s site inspection, please note the following. 

 

Quote: 

 

We attended upon your client on the afternoon of Wednesday 14 February 2024 and oversaw physical disposal of the stock by Mr Abdullah Ersheid, which is now complete.  

 

Now we are awaiting your client’s formal claim submission and supporting documents to allow us to finalise quantification of their claim.  This is not so much in relation to the stock, with respect to which we have the count records and documentation, albeit they should still include this information with their formal claim submission, but is more with respect to such as:

 

i.             Removal and making safe ceiling chandelier to allow the ceiling to be redecorated.

ii.           Cabinet replacements/repair

iii.          floor plinths replacements/repair

iv.          Desk repairs Etc.  

 

Ideally, your client should provide comparison repair quotations for the above, but if your client has a preferred vendor (the original contractor we presume, if so), their quotation would be acceptable, but we would appreciate sight of original fit-out costs for comparison purpose so we can assess whether the quotations are adequately stated/presented.

	Subject: FACES AL-Khairan (Water leakage)

	﻿ 

	Dear Louay & Emmanuel,

	Good morning,

	 

	In response to the request from the Mr. Louay, we reviewed CCTV cameras for FACES AL-KHAIRAN Kuwait and found that there was water leakage in the store floor from the ceiling at 02:31hrs and ended at 02:54hrs, 

	 

	Kindly find the attached snapshots for reference.

	 

	 

	Regards 

	Group security Control Room.
